October 15, 2021

Regularization

min⁡θ12∑i=1m∥y(i)−θTx(i)∥2+λ2∥θ∥2⏟regularization \min_{\theta} \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^{m} \|y^{(i)}-\theta^{T}x^{(i)} \|^2 + \underbrace{\frac{\lambda}{2} \|\theta\|^2}_{\text{regularization}} θmin​21​i=1∑m​∥y(i)−θTx(i)∥2+regularization2λ​∥θ∥2​​

Logitic regression problem

arg⁡max⁡θ∑i=1nlog⁡p(y(i) ∣ x(i);θ)−λ∥θ∥2 \arg \max_{\theta} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \log p \left( y^{(i)} \,|\, x^{(i)} ; \theta \right) - \lambda \|\theta\|^{2} argθmax​i=1∑n​logp(y(i)∣x(i);θ)−λ∥θ∥2

Probabilistic interpretation of regularization

Say SSS is the training set so that S={x(i),y(i)}i=1mS =\left\{ x^{(i)}, y^{(i)} \right\}^m_{i=1}S={x(i),y(i)}i=1m​ and you want to find the most likely value of θ\thetaθ so

P(θ∣S)=P(S∣θ)P(θ)P(S) P\left( \theta \mid S \right) = \frac{P\left( S \mid \theta \right) P \left( \theta \right) }{P\left( S \right) } \\ P(θ∣S)=P(S)P(S∣θ)P(θ)​
arg⁡max⁡θP(θ∣S)=arg⁡max⁡θP(S∣θ)P(θ)=arg⁡max⁡θ(∏i=1mP(yi∣xi;θ))⏟logistic regressionP(θ) \begin{aligned} &\arg \max_{\theta}P\left( \theta \mid S \right) = \arg \max_{\theta}P\left( S \mid \theta \right) P \left( \theta \right) \\ &= \arg \max_{\theta} \underbrace{\left( \prod^{m}_{i=1} P\left( y^{i} \mid x^{i};\theta \right) \right)}_{\text{logistic regression}} P\left( \theta \right) \end{aligned} ​argθmax​P(θ∣S)=argθmax​P(S∣θ)P(θ)=argθmax​logistic regression(i=1∏m​P(yi∣xi;θ))​​P(θ)​

Then

P(θ):θ∼N(0,τ2I)P(θ)=12π(τ2I)exp⁡(−12θT(τ2I)−1θ) P\left( \theta \right): \theta \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \tau^2 \mathcal{I} ) \\ P \left( \theta \right) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi} \left( \tau^2 \mathcal{I} \right) } \exp \left( \frac{-1}{2} \theta^{T} \left( \tau^2\mathcal{I} \right) ^{-1} \theta \right) P(θ):θ∼N(0,τ2I)P(θ)=2π​(τ2I)1​exp(2−1​θT(τ2I)−1θ)
